intro: Pritzelia angulata, commonly known as the angular pritzelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its angular, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals, and it produces small, round berries. Pritzelia angulata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
